parse.title: A Distant Flame Before the Sun

links.*: I Sit beside the Fire and Think

wikitext.*:
{{Song
| title = A Distant Flame Before the Sun
| album = [[Stronghold]]

| duration = 9:43
| track = 9
| spotify = https://open.spotify.com/track/4YOTRKvMLTh6m9MWOwzq5G
| writer = [[Summoning]]
}}'''''A Distant Flame Before the Sun''''' is the ninth and final track of the album [[Stronghold]] by the band [[Summoning]]. The lyrics are influenced by [[I Sit beside the Fire and Think]] and the ''[[Eärendillinwë]]'' from [[The Fellowship of the Ring]].<ref>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://www.tapatalk.com/groups/summoning/lyrical-sources-t383.html|articlename=Lyrical Sources|accessed=26 July 2024|author=Tapatalk Summoning Board}}</ref>

== Lyrics ==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
I sit beside the fire and think
Of how the world will be
When winter comes without a spring
That I shall ever see

I sit beside the fire and think
Of people long ago
And people who will see a world
That I shall never know

I sit beside the fire and think
Of older times that were before
I listen for returning feet
And voices at my door

On high above the mists I came
A distant flame before the sun
A wonder ere the waking dawn
Where grey the nordland waters run
In elder days and years of yore
</poem>{{References}}
[[Category:Songs by Summoning]]
